#Text=Renowned Indian guru Śrī Satya Sai Baba dies aged 84
#Text=Monday , April 25 , 2011
#Text=File : Бхагаван Шри Сатья Саи Баба .
#Text=jpg
#Text=Śrī Satya Sai Baba , taken by one of his followers ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=Śrī Satya Sai Baba
#Text=, one of India ' s most prominent spiritual leaders and revered by millions of followers worldwide , died Sunday in a Puttaparthi hospital , following a cardiac arrest .
#Text=He was 84 and had been in hospital since last month , suffering from kidney failure and respiratory problems .

#Text=Followers and devotees of Śrī Baba considered him to be the manifestation of a " living God " on Earth and believed he had powers of magic , such as being able to pull things from out of thin air .

column1: #Text=Former Indian Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee was one of Śrī Baba 's followers , as was international test cricketer Sachin Tendulkar .
#Text=Worshippers carried Baba 's image through the streets of Bangalore and extra police were deployed in his hometown of Puttaparthi .
#Text=In Delhi , masses gathered in temples and some refused to accept Baba 's death .

#Text=With an estimated six million followers , Baba saw donations allow for the expansion of his home village to include many temples , a hospital offering free medical care , a university , and an airport .
#Text=His first permanent facility opened 60 years ago .
#Text=Born Sathyanarayana Raju , Baba decided at the age of fourteen that he was the reincarnation of 19th-century guru Sai Baba of Shirdi .
#Text=The legend runs that Baba was stung by a scorpion and then sang religious chants in a language previously unknown to him .
#Text=He predicted his death in 2019 , as well as a third and final reincarnation in Karnataka state in 2023 .
#Text=He was a spiritual leader who inspired millions to lead a moral and meaningful life even as they followed the religion of their choice
#Text=— Prime Minister Singh
#Text=Nobody has been appointed to take over running the trust that promotes the faith , which has over 1,200 centres worldwide .
#Text=There are fears the family and trust could argue , leading to a government takeover .
#Text=" If the government has to take over the affairs of Sai Baba 's mission that could spell its end , " warned one devotee .

#Text=" Some people out of their mean-mindedness are trying to tarnish the image of Sai Baba , " said Baba in 2000 , after allegations of sexual abuse were made against him by young men , claims the BBC highlighted in 2004 .
#Text=" I am not after name and fame .

#Text=In 1993 , six people  died violently in the spiritual leader 's private rooms , " The Guardian reported .

column1: #Text=No full explanation has ever been given for the deaths , though speculation of a money dispute has been raised .

#Text=In a statement , current Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh said that the death of the guru was an " " irreparable loss " to India , adding , " He was a spiritual leader who inspired millions to lead a moral and meaningful life even as they followed the religion of their choice .
#Text="
